document_title: Diarrhea: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
When there are signs of diarrhea, the patient needs to contact a doctor for review and conduct some necessary tests to determine the exact cause. This is the basic foundation for implementing appropriate and effective treatment methods later.
1. Blood test
This is the most basic and common job. Testing complete blood count (CBC), inflammatory factors, blood electrolytes, liver and kidney function will help doctors diagnose the cause and provide appropriate treatment.
2. Stool test
Doctors can identify parasites, bacteria, and some viruses in stool cultures. Stool tests can also detect microscopic blood (red blood cells), white blood cells, and other clues to the diagnosis.
3. Colonoscopy
Through colonoscopy, the doctor will be able to observe the entire colon and part of the small intestine to accurately determine the damage here and find the cause of diarrhea. In addition, the endoscope is also equipped with support tools to help take a biopsy (a small tissue sample) from the colon for laboratory testing.
